title: Senior Regulatory Product Compliance Manager - Treasury
content:
Your mission
Wise has already pioneered new ways for people to transfer money across borders and currencies. Our customers can also manage their hard-earned money with the World’s first platform to offer true international multi-currency accounts. Your mission is to work with our Treasury team to ensure that we remain compliant with our safeguarding and custody regulatory requirements globally, whilst enabling us to continue launching exciting new products and features. 

Here’s how you’ll be contributing 
Enable Product Launches, acting as a subject matter expert on safeguarding regulations

Work with Regulatory Product Compliance regional team members and Product teams to identify key regulatory blockers, issues and/or interpretation points regarding new product developments and deliver solutions
Develop an escalation framework for product teams to escalate queries and receive timely input and feedback
Work as part of a global team, building good relationships with regional Compliance Officers and supporting them with regulatory notifications & external reporting in relation to Safeguarding

Incident management

Assess the materiality and risk related to specific incidents and assist product teams in responding with the requisite urgency 

Remediation & Improvement projects

Work with Treasury Product to drive remediation projects in response to periodic audits and testing
Identify key regulatory priorities given regional risk exposure and use this to motivate and prioritise the most important fixes
Advising on regulatory risks by mapping our control environment to regional regulatory obligations


This role will give you the opportunity to

Grow your hands-on Fintech knowledge at full speed
Choose your path to impact – we believe people are most empowered when they can act autonomously. So rather than telling you what to do, you’ll work with your team to create a vision of your own. Of course, you can always gather feedback from smart, curious people across Wise but you’ll have the freedom to make your own calls
Keep compliance right at the heart of the product development cycle, in a fast-moving environment and be empowered to identify ‘regulatory problems’ and take a lead in the solution design and implementation


A bit about you

You have Financial Regulation advisory experience in a Compliance/Legal department, Risk and Controls function, Finance function,  or in a consultancy/law firm environment  
You have deep knowledge of safeguarding regulatory obligations for payments firms as articulated in the revised Payments Services Directive (PSD2) and the Payment Services Regulations 2017 and Electronic Money Regulations 2011
You are customer obsessed, meaning you go deep into understanding them, identifying where to alleviate pain points and deliver empathy 
You’re always up for the challenge of analysing interpreting complex regulatory frameworks and apply them effectively
You’re able to work effectively with, and unblock Product Managers and Engineers and provide practical, actionable, and value added recommendations
You can roll up your sleeves to solve complex problems through using regulations together with data to drive business decisions 

Some extra, but not mandatory experience
You have a good understanding of Product Management principlesYou have experience working in Fintech and interpreting regulatory requirements in multiple jurisdictionsKnowledge of safeguarding obligations in non-UK/EU jurisdictions is also plus

Our Offer

Base salary: £82k - £108k gross / year base (based on experience & interview outcomes)


Restricted Stock Units (RSUs): https://www.wise.jobs/what-we-do/our-offer/


Including our London office perks: https://www.wise.jobs/2020/07/07/benefits-in-our-london-office/ 

 
#LI-SM1Salary (annual)£82,000—£108,000 GBPWe're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.
